title: 111_hr5333
content: The "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" is the short title of the Act. It involves the Department of Defense recognizing dependent children of members of the Armed Forces. The Act establishes a lapel button for eligible children of military service members serving on active duty for more than 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will approve the design and establish an application process for eligible members to request the button for their dependents. The Act establishes an application process for eligible members to request a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for their eligible child dependents. The presentation of the lapel button is conditioned upon payment of a fee to cover manufacturing and distribution costs. Each eligible child dependent can receive only one lapel button, regardless of the number of times the member serves on active duty. The Act limits the number of children of military service members commemorative lapel buttons that can be presented to eligible child dependents. Each dependent can receive one button, but if they are dependent on multiple members, they can receive a button for each member. If a button is lost or damaged without fault, it can be replaced upon application and payment. The Act allows for the replacement of commemorative lapel buttons for eligible child dependents of military service members if lost or damaged without fault. The term 'eligible child dependent' is defined as a dependent of a member of the armed forces. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations to ensure uniformity across all armed forces. The Act authorizes the design and manufacture of a commemorative lapel button for children of military service members. Congress urges the Secretary of Defense to expedite the implementation of the button and establish mechanisms for its issuance. The Secretary of Defense is also required to make the button retroactively available. The Secretary of Defense is required to make the children of military service members commemorative lapel button available to those who can prove eligibility as defined in the Act. An application process will be provided for eligible individuals. The Secretary of Defense will notify eligible members of the Armed Forces who served on active duty for more than 30 days since September 11, 2001, about the children of military service members commemorative lapel button. Notification should be given within 60 days of the Act's enactment. The children of military service members commemorative lapel button must be applied for within one year of the announcement by the Secretary of Defense. Costs, limitations, and exceptions apply as per section 1126a of title 10, United States Code. The children of military service members commemorative lapel button application must be made within one year of the Secretary of Defense's announcement. Costs, limitations, and exceptions from section 1126a of title 10, United States Code, apply to the presentation of the lapel button.
